result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marco E Morra

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marco E Morra in court.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Marco E Morra.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests a plea and sentencing hearing be set.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Marco E Morra in court.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Marco E Morra.  Prosecuting attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Camryn Arroyo, Justice Point Case Worker, in court. 

Case in Court to address Justice Point violation.  The Court takes no action as to bail at this time.  Defendant is admonished and reminded to follow all conditions of bail.  Case remains calendared for October 3, 2022 at 10:30 am in Br. 9.

Defendant Marco E Morra appeared by video at Justice Point.  Attorney William Hotchkiss appeared by video for Marco E Morra. Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker Camryn Arroyo.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes and reminds defendant of bail conditions. No action taken at this time. Case remains calendared for Scheduling Conference on 10-03-2022 in Branch 9.

Court ORDERS Justice Point SUPERVISION increased to Level 5.  Court ORDERS following modification to conditions: maintain absolute sobriety, undergo random urine screens, drug tests and breathalyzer test. All other conditions previously ordered remain the same.

Defendant Marco E Morra in court.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Marco E Morra.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defense has received discovery, but requests additional time to review videos. Request granted.  
Discussion held regarding modification of Justice Point Supervision based upon additional charges.  Court ORDERS Justice Point SUPERVISION increased to Level 5.  Court ORDERS following modification to conditions: maintain absolute sobriety, undergo random urine screens, drug tests and breathalyzer test. All other conditions previously ordered remain the same.

Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Scheduling conference set for October 3, 2022 at 10:30 a.m.

Defendant Marco E Morra in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Greenfield Officer C. Moglia. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.   
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marco E Morra in court by video with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen who appears in person.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Due to techincal issues and court congestion Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marco E Morra in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marco E Morra in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Marco E Morra in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marco E Morra appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
